Package xxl.core.math.numerics.integration

This package provides two techniques for the numerical integration of a real-valued function that is defined over an interval [a,b].

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    SimpsonsRuleRealFunctionArea
    This class provides the numerical integration of a real-valued function that is defined over an interval [a,b].
    TrapezoidalRuleRealFunctionArea
    This class provides the numerical integration of a real-valued function that is defined over an interval [a,b].

Package xxl.core.math.numerics.integration Description

This package provides two techniques for the numerical integration of a real-valued function that is defined over an interval [a,b]. Both of them belong to the class of Newton-Cotes-Formulas. On the one hand there is the Simpson's Rule that bases on three weights, providing an approximation of order 4. On the other hand there is Trapezoidal Rule that bases on two weights, providing an approximation of order 2. Both techniques are applied iteratively by partitioning the interval.
